result.execSummary:
The defendant Leandre D. Dawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leandre D. Dawson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leandre D. Dawson was found guilty of Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Leandre D. Dawson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.    If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. May Not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations (Get out of the GMB).  May Not have contact with victim and Jacob P.  DOC SHALL PROMPTLY NOTIFY THE COURT OF ANY NEW ARREST OR CRIMINAL CHARGE MADE AGAINST THE DEFT.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed for work and school.Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  NO HUBER.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 5yrs on count 1 & 1yr on count 2.  Probation sentences are concurrent.  See conditions.  Restitution ordered.  Deft sentenced to 6mos KCJ as a condition of probation.  Huber for work & school.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

943.32(1)(a) - Robbery with  Use Of Force/PTAC 940.19(1) - Battery  / PTAC
DRAFT NO 2
DRAFT NO. 1
Verdict - DRAFT NO. 1
PRELIMINARY

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Arguments heard on various issues.  Defense filed a motion to dismiss count 3; State has no objection and concurs.  Count 3 is dismissed.  Motion for exclusion of witnesses is granted with exception to Det. Hecker.  State moves for an offer of proof on the two witnesses from Tremper that the defense intends to call as character witnesses on behalf of deft; motion taken under advisement.   Jurors reconvene @ 9:20am.  Jurors sworn.  Preliminary instructions given to jury.  Opening statements.  Testimony commences.  State's witnesses - Seth K., P.O. Wenberg, & Jacob P.  Jurors released @ 11:21am for lunch; instructed to return @ 12:30pm.  Miranda Goodchild hrg held.  Testimony taken from Det. Josh Hecker.  Court finds the statement(s) given by the deft were voluntarily and are admissible in the State's case-in-chief.  Deft questioned on whether he wishes to testify - deft would like more time to speak w/his counsel.  Deft may discuss this w/his atty over the lunch break.  Parties released @ 11:39am; instructed to return @ 12:30pm.  Attys/deft reconvene in courtroom @ 12:30pm.  Atty Rose reports the deft wishes to testify.  Jurors reconvene in the courtroom @ 12:47pm.  Testimony continues  - Det. Josh Hecker.  State's exhibits #1 & #2 offered and received.  State rests @ 1:04pm.  Court takes a short recess.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:37pm in the courtroom.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from Leandre Dawson, Asst. Principal Brian Geiger, Dean of Students Frank Matrise Jr.  Defense rests @ 2:11pm.  Rebuttal witness - Det. Hecker.  Portion of the taped interview of deft played for the juror; due to technical difficulties the entire portion cannot be played for the jury.  State's exhibit #3 offered and received.  Rebuttal rests @ 3:20pm.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror - Derrick D.  Jury commences deliberations @ 4:06pm.  Verdict reached @ 4:19pm.  Deft found guilty on both counts.  Jury polled.  Jurors released for the day @ 4:30pm.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  No response from defense.  Deft found guilty as charged in the information.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/29/15 @ 11am.  Bond is revoked; deft remanded into custody
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Voir dire; 13 jurors chosen.  Jury trial to begin on 3/17/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
